What are the ten?

The purity of the speech precepts, because one is free from the four faults of speech;
The purity of the mind precepts, because one is forever free from greed, anger, and wrong views;
The purity of the precepts that do not violate any training, because one becomes the honored lord among all humans and gods;

The pure patience of peacefully enduring weapons and sticks, in order to well protect oneself and others;
The pure patience of not giving rise to anger or harm, because one's mind is unmoved;
The pure patience of not blaming the lowly, because one is able to be magnanimous towards the superior;
The pure patience of rescuing all those who come for refuge, in order to abandon one's own life;
The pure patience of being far removed from arrogance, in order not to slight those who have not yet studied;
Pure patience of not being angry at harm, because one observes it to be like an illusion;
Pure patience of not retaliating when harmed, because one does not see self and other;
Pure patience of not following afflictions, because one is free from all objects;
Pure patience of knowing that all dharmas are unborn in accordance with the true wisdom of bodhisattvas, because one enters the realm of omniscience without relying on the teachings of others.

If bodhisattvas abide in them, they will attain the patience of the unsurpassed Dharma of all buddhas that does not rely on realization through others.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have ten kinds of pure vigor.
What are the ten?
Namely:
Physical purity vigor, serving and making offerings to buddhas, bodhisattvas, and various teachers and elders, and not turning back from the field of blessings;
Verbal purity vigor, widely speaking the Dharma for others according to what one has heard, and praising the merits of buddhas without fatigue;
The purity of mental exertion is the diligence of being able to enter and exit loving-kindness, compassion, joy, equanimity, meditation, liberation, and various samÄdhis without rest;
The purity of the upright mind is the diligence of being without deceit, flattery, crookedness, or pretense, and diligently cultivating everything without turning back;
The purity of the superior mind is the diligence of always aspiring for higher and higher wisdom, and vowing to possess all pure dharmas;
The purity of not wasting is the diligence of embracing giving, morality, patience, learning, and heedfulness, and not resting until attaining enlightenment;
The purity of subduing all mÄras is the diligence of being able to eliminate greed, anger, delusion, wrong views, all afflictions, and entangling hindrances;

The purity of perfecting the light of wisdom is the diligence of observing whatever is done well, causing it to be ultimately accomplished without regret, and attaining all the unique qualities of the buddhas;

Pure effort without coming or going, attaining true wisdom, entering the Dharma realm, body, speech, and mind all equally, understanding characteristics and non-characteristics, because of non-attachment;

Accomplishing the pure effort of the light of Dharma, surpassing all stages, attaining the Buddha's empowerment, using the uncontaminated body to manifest birth and death, renunciation, enlightenment, teaching the Dharma, and nirvana, fully possessing such universal activities.
These are the ten.
If bodhisattvas abide in these principles, they will attain the TathÄgata's unsurpassed great pure effort.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have ten kinds of pure meditation.

Attaining true good friends, pure meditation, because of demonstrating and teaching the right path;

The samÄdhi of pure beings who are free from the clamor of crowds, because they always delight in tranquility;

Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have ten kinds of pure wisdom.

The pure wisdom of knowing non-annihilation and non-permanence is because it thoroughly understands that all dependent origination is as it really is;
The pure wisdom of uprooting all views is because it does not grasp or abandon the characteristics of sentient beings;
The pure wisdom of observing the mental activities of all sentient beings is because it understands them to be like illusions;

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have ten kinds of pure great compassion.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have ten kinds of pure compassion.
What are the ten?

Pure compassion taking birth in difficult circumstances, because one saves sentient beings;
